result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin F Hopinkah in court.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE on his petition for court-appointed counsel.  DE applied for PD and was denied.  Current paperwork states he is employed by Jimmy John's.  Confusion re: employment status noted.  Also get a stipend from the Ho-Chunk tribe.  Court finds DE is conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse COC's office $75/month to commence on or before 10/1/22 and then by the first of each month thereafter.  Address confirmed.  Prelim reset.  Bond continued.  Court notes she will not reset any further hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. Dolch makes argument for $100 cash.   Court sets $100.00 Cash bond and all other conditions previously ordered contiues.

03:57 PM Defendant Benjamin F Hopinkah in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE re: counsel.  DE states he made contact w/"Martin" but hasn't heard back.  Court notes DE has Atty Martinez in another matter.  Court advises DE of his right to counsel and indigency process.  Court reminds DE of upcoming court dates.  DE updates his address for the record.
